definition: Parameters quantifying the extent or direction of atmospheric movement. Obvious examples are wind velocity, windspeed and wind direction, but can also include derived parameters such as force, energy, power and power density.
The amount (mass or quantity of matter) of silicate per amount (volume or mass) of a body of water
The amount (mass or quantity of matter) of nitrite per amount (volume or mass) of a body of water
The amount (mass or quantity of matter) of nitrate per amount (volume or mass) of a body of water

MeasurementType: Ammonium and ammonia concentration parameters in water bodies
definition: Ammonium and ammonia concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in any body of fresh or salt water.

MeasurementType: Salinity of the water body by STD
definition: Direct reading salinity sensor (e.g. STD)
The mass of sodium chloride dissolved per unit mass of the water column (definition prior to introduction of PSS-78 Practical Salinity Scale).
The amount (volume, mass or quantity of matter) of dissolved oxygen per amount (volume or mass) of a body of water.
Temperature parameters in any body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere excluding the top few microns sampled by radiometers known as the skin
Speed of wind {wind speed} in the atmosphere by visual estimation and conversion to Beaufort scale.
The degree of hotness of the water column expressed against a standard scale. Includes both IPTS-68 and ITS-90 scales.
comments: Most used ID in the mof viewer for general water temp

definition: The number of an identified biological object described elsewhere in the metadata in the sample or observation.

A standard body length measurement used in fish biometric studies for fishes with forked tails and taken as the distance measured from the tip of the snout in a straight line to the posterior end of the shortest caudal rays in the center of the fork. The biological entity is identified elsewhere in the data schema.

A body length measurement used in fish biometric studies and taken as the distance measured from the snout to the posterior edge of the posterior lobe of the second dorsal fin. The biological entity is identified elsewhere in the data schema.

MeasurementType: Length (total length) of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: A standard body length measurement used in biometric studies and taken as the longest distance along the main axis. In fish biometrics, this is the distance from the tip of the snout in a straight line to the posterior end of the caudal fin.

MeasurementType: Length of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: The mean length of specimens of a biological object (identified elsewhere in the data or metadata) in the sample or observation. This may refer to a single individual if the count is one.
The physical length of a sample upon which measurements have been made
The weight of the sample as collected.

The length of a fish measured from the tip of the snout to the posterior end of the last vertebra or to the posterior end of the midlateral portion of the hypural plate. Simply put, this measurement excludes the length of the caudal fin.

MeasurementType: Count (in assayed sample) of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: Count (in assayed sample) of biological entity specified elsewhere

MeasurementType: Specimen weight of biological entitiy specified elsewhere
definition: The weight of biological specimens identified elsewhere in the data or metadata. The method used to determine specimen weight should be recorded in the usage metadata.

MeasurementType: Wet weight biomass (in assayed sample) of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: The combined weight of individuals of a biological object (identified elsewhere in the data or metadata) in the sample or observation.

MeasurementType: Preserved wet weight of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: The wet weight of a biological sample following preservation in formaldehyde (formalin) or ethanol for example. The biological entity is identified elsewhere in the data model.

MeasurementType: Specimen age of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: The mean age of specimens of a biological object (identified elsewhere in the data or metadata) in the sample or observation. This may refer to a single individual if the sample count is one.

MeasurementType: Abundance of biological entity specified elsewhere per unit volume of the water body
definition: The number of an identified biological object described elsewhere in the metadata occurring in a given volume of any body of salt or fresh water.
Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by weighing unprocessed catch samples.

The weight of both organic and inorganic (i.e. mineral) matter of biological organisms in a given area, volume or mass of environmental matrix after all the water has been removed. This is typically done by baking samples at a temperature low enough to avoid combustion (typically around 60 degrees Celsius) followed by a period in a sealed container containing a desiccant.

Alt labels: Development stage of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: The life cycle development stage of the biological object.

MeasurementType: Presence or absence of biological entity specified elsewhere by using 0 or 1 binary classification
definition: Statement of whether a biological entity (identified elsewhere in the data or metadata) is present (1) or absent (0).

MeasurementType: Preserved wet weight of biological entity specified elsewhere
definition: The wet weight of a biological sample following preservation in formaldehyde (formalin) or ethanol for example. The biological entity is identified elsewhere in the data model.
The vertical dimension of the mouth opening of a sample collecting device such as a plankton net or a trawl
The period of time during which a sample was collected or an observation was made, such as a the time a net was towed through the water or duration of a visual census.
Speed of towing platform
The horizontal dimension of the mouth opening of a sample collecting device such as a plankton net or a trawl

MeasurementType: Volume sampled of teh water body
definition: The volume of the water body from which a sample was collected or in which an observation was made, such as the area swept during a net haul.
The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used to produce the sample.

The linear distance along which a sample was collected or an observation was made, such as a beach transect length, the track of a sampling net through water, or the track of a benthic sampler along the seafloor.
The vertical location of an object or an observation in a water body or in the sediment expressed as the distance below a specified datum.
The depth of the sea floor or bed relative to a reference datum.
The maximum distance between an underwater sampling or measuring activity and the sea surface

MeasurementType: Depth (spatial coordinate) of sampling event start relative to water surface in the water body
definition: The distance below the surface of a water body at which sampling begins.

MeasurementType: Depth (spatial coordinate) of sampling event end relative to water surface in the water body
definition: The distance below the surface of a water body at which sampling stops.
The name or description of the method used to preserve the sample after collection and prior to the analysis.
